name: src/controller/authorization.js
delay
description: Simulates a delay by wrapping a Promise around JavaScript's native `setTimeout` function.

params.name: ms
params.description: The amount of time to delay for, in milliseconds

name: Authorization
description:
Encapsulates all of the logic for communication with the [Authorization Service](http://dev.npr.org/api/#/authorization)
in the NPR One API.

Note that consumers should not be accessing this class directly but should instead use the provided pass-through
functions in the main {@link NprOneSDK} class.
examples:
<caption>Rudimentary example of implementing the Device Code flow</caption>
const nprOneSDK = new NprOneSDK();
nprOneSDK.config = { ... };
const scopes = ['identity.readonly', 'identity.write', 'listening.readonly', 'listening.write'];
nprOneSDK.getDeviceCode(scopes)
    .then((deviceCodeModel) => {
        // display code to user on the screen
        nprOneSDK.pollDeviceCode()
            .then(() => {
                nprOneSDK.getRecommendation();
            });
     })
    .catch(() => {
        nprOneSDK.getDeviceCode(scopes).then(...); // repeat ad infinitum until `pollDeviceCode()` resolves successfully
        // In actual use, it may be preferable to refactor this into a recursive function
    ));

name: constructor
description: Initializes the controller class with private variables needed later on.

name: refreshExistingAccessToken
description: Attempts to swap the existing access token for a new one using the refresh token endpoint in the OAuth proxy

params.name: numRetries
params.description: The number of times this function has been tried. Will retry up to 3 times.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or no access token is set

name: logout
description:
Logs out the user, revoking their access token from the authorization server and removing the refresh token from
the secure storage in the backend proxy (if a backend proxy is configured). Note that the consuming client is
still responsible for removing the access token anywhere else it might be stored outside of this SDK (e.g. in
localStorage or elsewhere in application memory).

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or no access token is currently set

name: getDeviceCode
description:
Uses the OAuth proxy to start a `device_code` grant flow. This function _just_ makes an API call that produces a
device code/user code pair, and should be followed up with a call to {@link pollDeviceCode} in order to complete
the process.

Note that device code/user code pairs do expire after a set time, so the consuming client may need to call these
2 functions multiple times before the user logs in. It is a good idea to encapsulate them in a function which
can be called recursively on errors; see the example below for details.

params.name: scopes
params.description: The scopes (as strings) that should be associated with the resulting access token

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured

name: pollDeviceCode
description:
Uses the OAuth proxy to poll the access token endpoint as part of a `device_code` grant flow. This endpoint will
continue to poll until the user successfully logs in, _or_ the user goes to log in but then denies the request
for access to their account by this client, _or_ the device code/user code pair expires, whichever comes first.
In the first case, it will automatically set {@link NPROneSDK.accessToken} to the newly-generated access token,
and the consuming client can proceed to play recommendations immediately; in the other 2 cases, it will return
a Promise that rejects with a debugging message, but the next course of action would generally be to call
{@link getDeviceCode} again and start the whole process from the top.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or `getDeviceCode()` was not previously called

name: _pollDeviceCodeOnce
description:
Polls the device code once. If the result is an error of type `'authorization_pending'`, this will recurse,
calling itself after a delay equal to the interval specified in the original call to {@link getDeviceCode}.

name: src/controller/identity.js
Identity
description:
Encapsulates all of the logic for communication with the [Identity Service](http://dev.npr.org/api/#/identity)
in the NPR One API.

Note that consumers should not be accessing this class directly but should instead use the provided pass-through
functions in the main {@link NprOneSDK} class.
examples:
<caption>How to change a user's station using station search</caption>
const nprOneSDK = new NprOneSDK();
nprOneSDK.config = { ... };
nprOneSDK.getUser() // optional; verifies that you have a logged-in user
    .then(() => {
       return nprOneSDK.searchStations('wnyc');
    })
    .then((stations) => {
        const stationId = stations[0].id; // in reality, you'd probably have the user select a station, see the StationFinder for detail
        nprOneSDK.setUserStation(stationId);
    });

name: getUser
description:
Gets user metadata, such as first and last name, programs they have shown an affinity for, and preferred NPR One
station.

name: setUserStation
description:
Sets a user's favorite NPR station. Note that this function will first validate whether the station with the given
ID actually exists, and will return a promise that rejects if not.

params.name: stationId
params.description: The station's ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

name: followShow
description:
Indicates that the user wishes to follow, or subscribe to, the show, program, or podcast with the given numeric
ID. Followed shows will appear more frequently in a user's list of recommendations.

Note that at this time, because we have not yet implemented search in this SDK, there is no way to retrieve a list
of aggregation (show) IDs through this SDK. You can either add functionality to your own app that makes an API call
to `GET https://api.npr.org/listening/v2/search/recommendations` with a program name or other search parameters, or
wait until we implement search in this SDK (hopefully later this year).

params.name: aggregationId
params.description: The aggregation (show) ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

throws.description: if the passed-in aggregation (show) ID is not either a number or a numeric string

name: unfollowShow
description:
Indicates that the user wishes to unfollow, or unsubscribe from, the show, program, or podcast with the given
numeric ID. See {@link followShow} for more information.

params.name: aggregationId
params.description: The aggregation (show) ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

throws.description: if the passed-in aggregation (show) ID is not either a number or a numeric string

name: _setFollowingStatusForShow
description: Primary workhorse for {@link followShow} and {@link unfollowShow}.

params.name: aggregationId
params.description: The aggregation (show) ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

params.name: shouldFollow
params.description: Whether or not the aggregation should be followed (`true`) or unfollowed (`false`)

throws.description: if the passed-in aggregation (show) ID is not either a number or a numeric string

name: createTemporaryUser
description:
Creates a temporary user from the NPR One API and use that user's access token for
subsequent API requests.

Caution: most clients are not authorized to use temporary users.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or no client ID is set

name: src/controller/listening.js
Listening
description:
Encapsulates all of the logic for communication with the [Listening Service](http://dev.npr.org/api/#/listening)
in the NPR One API.

Note that consumers should not be accessing this class directly but should instead use the provided pass-through
functions in the main {@link NprOneSDK} class.
examples:
<caption>Implementing a rudimentary 'Explore' view</caption>
const nprOneSDK = new NprOneSDK();
nprOneSDK.config = { ... };
nprOneSDK.getRecommendationsFromChannel('recommended')
    .then((recommendations) => {
        // in a real app, the user would select a piece; here we've simulated them selecting one at index 3
        const selectedRecommendationId = recommendations[3].attributes.uid;
        return nprOneSDK.queueRecommendationFromChannel('recommended', selectedRecommendationId);
     })
    .then(() => {
        nprOneSDK.getRecommendation(); // proceed to play the recommendation
    });

name: constructor
description: Initializes the controller class with private variables needed later on.

name: getRecommendation
description:
Get a recommendation from NPR.

Caution: the resulting recommendation may have been returned previously and must be checked
to ensure the same recommendation is not played twice.

params.name: uid
params.description: Optional; a UID for a specific recommendation to play. In 99% of use cases, this is not needed.

params.name: channel
params.description: Optional; a channel to pull the recommendation from; the main flow channel of `npr` is used as the default. In 99% of use cases, this does not need to be changed.

name: getUpcomingFlowRecommendations
description:
Return possible recommendations that may come next in the flow. Useful for
pre-caching audio and displaying upcoming recommendations.

Recommendations returned are not guaranteed to always come next in the flow.

params.name: channel
params.description: A channel to pull the next recommendation from

name: getRecommendationsFromChannel
description:
Makes a new API call to get a list of recommendations. This is NOT intended for regular piece-by-piece consumption;
this function is designed to be used for consumers implementing e.g. the Explore view from the NPR One apps,
where the client displays a list or grid of content, and the user can select a piece to listen to next.
It is hard-coded to use the "recommended" channel by default, although other channels can be used also. That said,
you should really never use this with channel "npr" (the main flow channel), as this is not how that content is
intended to be consumed.

params.name: channel
params.description: A non-flow (i.e. non-`npr`) channel to retrieve a list of recommendations from

name: queueRecommendationFromChannel
description:
This synchronous method is intended to be used alongside {@link getRecommendationsFromChannel}.
Once you have a list of recommendations from a channel and an audio story has been selected to play, this method
ensures that the correct ratings (actions) will be sent and the flow of audio will continue appropriately with
the necessary API calls.
If the recommendation with the given UID can be found, it is delivered immediately to be played.
Importantly, this function also returns the selected recommendation on a subsequent call to getRecommendation
(assuming no other ratings are sent in between), so that the consumer can assume that the correct recommendation
will be played next.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel used in the original call to `getRecommendationsFromChannel()`

params.name: uid
params.description: The unique ID of the item to queue up for the user

throws.description: If no valid channel or UID is passed in
If no recommendations for this channel were previously cached, or if the UID was not found in that cached list

name: getHistory
description: Retrieves a user's history as an array of recommendation objects.

name: resetFlow
description:
Resets the current flow for the user. Note that 99% of the time, clients will never have to do this (and it is
generally considered an undesirable user experience), but in a few rare cases it might be needed. The best example
is after calling `setUserStation()` if the current recommendation is of `type === 'stationId'`; in this case,
resetting the flow may be necessary in order to make the user aware that they successfully changed their station.

name: resumeFlowFromRecommendation
description:
Given a valid JSON recommendation object, the flow will advance as
normal from this recommendation. This method has been created for
a special case (Chromecast sharing) and is not intended for use
in a traditional SDK implementation.

NOTE: this function will overwrite ALL existing flow
recommendations.

params.name: json
params.description: Recommendation JSON Object (CDoc+JSON)

name: _advanceFlowRecommendations
description: Advances the flow (retrieves new recommendations from the API).

throws.description: If there are no recommendations to return

name: _filterIncomingRecommendations
description: Provide any necessary filter to incoming recommendations if needed

name: _recordRating
description: Private method to facilitate communication of a rated recommendation.

name: _getFlowRecommendations
description:
Request for recommendations from NPR specifically for the flow as opposed to
other channels which will not change the current flow.

name: _createRecommendations
description: Create recommendation objects from collection doc

params.name: json
params.description: collection doc

name: _sendRatings
description: Send batched ratings

params.name: recommendMore
params.description: determines if additional recommendations should be returned

name: _queuedRatingsContainsRating
description:
Returns whether currently queued ratings contain a specific rating

This is not a deep copy check and relies on mediaId & rating string

name: _queuedRatingsContainsAction
description: Returns whether the currently queued ratings contains a specific action

name: src/controller/station-finder.js
StationFinder
description:
Encapsulates all of the logic for communication with the [Station Finder Service](http://dev.npr.org/api/#/stationfinder)
in the NPR One API.

Note that consumers should not be accessing this class directly but should instead use the provided pass-through
functions in the main {@link NprOneSDK} class.
examples:
<caption>How to change a user's station using station search</caption>
const nprOneSDK = new NprOneSDK();
nprOneSDK.config = { ... };
nprOneSDK.getUser() // optional; verifies that you have a logged-in user
    .then(() => {
        return nprOneSDK.searchStations('wnyc');
    })
    .then((stations) => {
        const stationId = stations[0].id; // in reality, you'd probably have the user select a station from returned search results
        nprOneSDK.setUserStation(stationId);
    });

name: searchStations
description:
Performs a general search of all NPR One stations, using an optional query. If passed in, the query can be any
string, such as an address or keyword, but the recommended usage is to search for station names, network names
(e.g. "Colorado Public Radio" is a network of stations throughout Colorado), or zip codes.

If no query is passed in, this function will return a list of one or more stations geographically closest to the
client based on the consumer's IP address. If you are running this in a server-side environment where the IP
address of the server is not necessarily the same as the IP address (and, by extension, the geographic location)
of the end-user, you can use {@link searchStationsByLatLongCoordinates} instead to retrieve a list of stations
geographically closest to the end-user.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query, which can be a station name, network name, or zip code

name: searchStationsByLatLongCoordinates
description:
Performs a geographic search of all NPR One stations using a passed-in pair of lat-long coordinates. In most
cases, this means you will need to first use the [HTML5 Geolocation API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Geolocation/Using_geolocation)
or a similar library in order to obtain the lat-long coordinates for the end-user's location.

Note that {@link searchStations} without a query will already produce a list of stations closest to the user _if_
this code is being run in a client-side environment and/or the IP address of the device making the calls to this
SDK has the same geographic location as the end-user. For that reason, `searchStationsByLatLongCoordinates()`
is really only needed if this SDK is being run in a server-side environment.

params.name: lat
params.description: A float representing the latitude value of the geographic coordinates

params.name: long
params.description: A float representing the longitude value of the geographic coordinates

name: searchStationsByCityAndState
description:
Performs a geographic search of all NPR One stations using a city name and state. While you _can_ pass in a city
_or_ state to {@link searchStations} as the query, `searchStationsByCityAndState()` will return more accurate
results and is the recommended function for clients wanting to offer a location search.

params.name: city
params.description: A full city name (e.g. "New York", "San Francisco", "Phoenix")

params.name: state
params.description: A state name (e.g. "Maryland") or abbreviation (e.g. "MD")

name: searchStationsByCity
description:
Performs a geographic search of all NPR One stations using a city name only. It is generally recommended that you
use {@link searchStationsByCityAndState} instead, as it will return more accurate results and is the recommended
function for clients wanting to offer a location search.

params.name: city
params.description: A full city name (e.g. "New York", "San Francisco", "Phoenix")

name: searchStationsByState
description:
Performs a geographic search of all NPR One stations using a state name or abbreviation only. It is generally
recommended that you use {@link searchStationsByCityAndState} instead, as it will return more accurate results
and is the recommended function for clients wanting to offer a location search.

params.name: state
params.description: A state name (e.g. "Maryland") or abbreviation (e.g. "MD")

name: getStationDetails
description: Returns a {@link Station} model for the station with the given ID.

params.name: stationId
params.description: The station's ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

name: validateStation
description:
Ensures a station ID is associated with a valid NPR station. While this technically returns the raw JSON for
this station if it exists, these results are not meant to be consumed directly; if you need the station details to display to your end-user,
use {@link getStationDetails} instead.

params.name: stationId
params.description: The station's ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

name: _performStationSearch
description: A private helper function that performs the actual station search.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query, which can be a station name, network name, or zip code

params.name: lat
params.description: A float representing the latitude value of the geographic coordinates

params.name: long
params.description: A float representing the longitude value of the geographic coordinates

params.name: city
params.description: A full city name (e.g. "New York", "San Francisco", "Phoenix")

params.name: state
params.description: A state name (e.g. "Maryland") or abbreviation (e.g. "MD")

name: src/error/api-error.js
ApiError
description:
A custom error class to encapsulate errors thrown by {@link FetchUtil.nprApiFetch}. Behaves like a generic JavaScript
error, but has additional metadata attached to it in case consuming code needs to be able to respond to specific
kinds of errors.

name: constructor
description:
Creates a new, custom error using the [Fetch Response](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response)
object as its basis.

params.name: response
params.description: The actual raw [Fetch Response](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response) from the failed API call

params.name: json
params.description: If available, the decoded JSON from the error response

name: statusCode
description: The status code of the response (e.g., `400` for a bad request).

name: statusText
description: The status message corresponding to the status code (e.g., `Bad Request` for 400).

name: headers
description: The headers associated with the response.

name: responseType
description: Contains the type of the response (e.g., basic, cors).

name: responseUrl
description: Contains the URL of the response.

name: json
description: Contains the decoded JSON of the response, if any.

name: src/index.js
NprOneSDK
description:
This SDK attempts to abstract away most of the interaction with the NPR One API.
In general, a consumer of this API should be primarily concerned with asking for
recommendations and recording user actions against those recommendations.

name: constructor
description: Instantiates the NPR One SDK.

properties.name: apiBaseUrl
properties.description: The NPR One API hostname and protocol, typically `https://api.npr.org`; in most cases, this does not need to be manually set by clients

properties.name: apiVersion
properties.description: The NPR One API version, typically `v2`; in most cases, this does not need to be manually set by clients

properties.name: authProxyBaseUrl
properties.description: The full URL to your OAuth proxy, e.g. `http://one.example.com/oauth2/`

properties.name: newDeviceCodePath
properties.description: The path to your proxy for starting a `device_code` grant (relative to `authProxyBaseUrl`)

properties.name: pollDeviceCodePath
properties.description: The path to your proxy for polling a `device_code` grant (relative to `authProxyBaseUrl`)

properties.name: refreshTokenPath
properties.description: The path to your proxy for the `refresh_token` grant (relative to `authProxyBaseUrl`)

properties.name: tempUserPath
properties.description: The path to your proxy for the `temporary_user` grant (relative to `authProxyBaseUrl`), not available to third-party clients

properties.name: logoutPath
properties.description: The path to your proxy for the `POST /authorization/v2/token/revoke` endpoint (relative to `authProxyBaseUrl`)

properties.name: accessToken
properties.description: The access token to use if not using the auth proxy

properties.name: clientId
properties.description: The NPR One API `client_id` to use, only required if using the auth proxy with the `temporary_user` grant type

properties.name: advertisingId
properties.description: The custom X-Advertising-ID header to send with most requests, not typically used by third-party clients

properties.name: advertisingTarget
properties.description: The custom X-Advertising-Target header to send with most requests, not typically used by third-party clients

name: config
description: Updates private `_config` member attributes but does not overwrite entire `_config` object

name: onAccessTokenChanged
description:
Sets a callback to be triggered whenever the SDK rotates the access token for a new one, usually when
the old token expires and a `refresh_token` is used to generate a fresh token. Clients who wish to persist
access tokens across sessions are urged to use this callback to be notified whenever a token change has
occurred; the only other alternative is to call `get accessToken()` after every API call.

throws.description: if the passed-in value isn't a function

name: Action
description: Exposes the Action class for clients to record actions

name: Logger
description: Exposes the Logger class for clients to adjust logging if desired

name: refreshExistingAccessToken
description: See {@link Authorization.refreshExistingAccessToken} for description.

params.name: numRetries
params.description: The number of times this function has been tried. Will retry up to 3 times.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or no access token is set

name: logout
description: See {@link Authorization#logout} for description.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or no access token is currently set

name: getDeviceCode
description: See {@link Authorization#getDeviceCode} for description.

params.name: scopes
params.description: The scopes (as strings) that should be associated with the resulting access token

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured

name: pollDeviceCode
description: See {@link Authorization#pollDeviceCode} for description.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or `getDeviceCode()` was not previously called

name: getRecommendation
description: See {@link Listening#getRecommendation} for description.

params.name: uid
params.description: Optional; a UID for a specific recommendation to play. In 99% of use cases, this is not needed.

params.name: channel
params.description: Optional; a channel to pull the recommendation from; the main flow channel of `npr` is used as the default. In 99% of use cases, this does not need to be changed.

name: resumeFlowFromRecommendation
description: See {@link Listening#resumeFlowFromRecommendation} for description.

params.name: json
params.description: JSON object representation of a recommendation

name: getUpcomingFlowRecommendations
description: See {@link Listening#getUpcomingFlowRecommendations} for description.

params.name: channel
params.description: A channel to pull the next recommendation from

name: getRecommendationsFromChannel
description: See {@link Listening#getRecommendationsFromChannel} for description.

params.name: channel
params.description: A non-flow (i.e. non-`npr`) channel to retrieve a list of recommendations from

name: queueRecommendationFromChannel
description: See {@link Listening#queueRecommendationFromChannel} for description.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel used in the original call to `getRecommendationsFromChannel()`

params.name: uid
params.description: The unique ID of the item to queue up for the user

throws.description: If no valid channel or UID is passed in
If no recommendations for this channel were previously cached, or if the UID was not found in that cached list

name: getHistory
description: See {@link Listening#getHistory} for description.

name: resetFlow
description: See {@link Listening#resetFlow} for description.

name: getUser
description: See {@link Identity#getUser} for description.

name: setUserStation
description: See {@link Identity#setUserStation} for description.

params.name: stationId
params.description: The station's ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

name: followShow
description: See {@link Identity#followShow} for description.

params.name: aggregationId
params.description: The aggregation (show) ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

throws.description: if the passed-in aggregation (show) ID is not either a number or a numeric string

name: unfollowShow
description: See {@link Identity#unfollowShow} for description.

params.name: aggregationId
params.description: The aggregation (show) ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

throws.description: if the passed-in aggregation (show) ID is not either a number or a numeric string

name: createTemporaryUser
description: See {@link Identity#createTemporaryUser} for description.

throws.description: if an OAuth proxy is not configured or no client ID is set

name: searchStations
description: See {@link StationFinder#searchStations} for description.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query, which can be a station name, network name, or zip code

name: searchStationsByLatLongCoordinates
description: See {@link StationFinder#searchStationsByLatLongCoordinates} for description.

params.name: lat
params.description: A float representing the latitude value of the geographic coordinates

params.name: long
params.description: A float representing the longitude value of the geographic coordinates

name: searchStationsByCityAndState
description: See {@link StationFinder#searchStationsByCityAndState} for description.

params.name: city
params.description: A full city name (e.g. "New York", "San Francisco", "Phoenix")

params.name: state
params.description: A state name (e.g. "Maryland") or abbreviation (e.g. "MD")

name: searchStationsByCity
description: See {@link StationFinder#searchStationsByCity} for description.

params.name: city
params.description: A full city name (e.g. "New York", "San Francisco", "Phoenix")

name: searchStationsByState
description: See {@link StationFinder#searchStationsByState} for description.

params.name: state
params.description: A state name (e.g. "Maryland") or abbreviation (e.g. "MD")

name: getStationDetails
description: See {@link StationFinder#getStationDetails} for description.

params.name: stationId
params.description: The station's ID, which is either an integer or a numeric string (e.g. `123` or `'123'`)

name: getServiceUrl
description: Returns the foundational path for a given service

name: src/model/access-token.js
AccessToken
description: A thin wrapper around the raw JSON returned from the authorization server to represent an access token

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

name: validate
description: Ensure that the given access token model is valid

throws.description: if access token model is invalid

name: isExpired
description:
Returns whether or not this access token has expired.
Note that due to network latency, etc., it's possible that the internally-stored expiry date could be about a
second or so behind, and so this function is not guaranteed to be perfectly accurate.

name: token
description: Returns the access token itself (40-character alphanumeric string)

name: ttl
description:
Returns the TTL (in milliseconds) until this access token expires. If you are using an auth proxy and have
correctly configured the `refreshTokenUrl`, this SDK will automatically refresh expired access tokens for you,
so consumers typically do not need to worry about whether or not a token is expired or about to expire.

name: toString
description:
A convenience function to cast this object back to a string, generally only used by the {@link Logger} class.
In this case, we return only the `access_token` itself, since the rest of the object is typically not useful.

name: src/model/action.js
Action
description:
Actions that can be recorded for recommendations.
For more detail on user rating actions, see our narrative [Listening Service documentation](http://dev.npr.org/guide/services/listening/#Ratings)

name: getEndActions
description: Actions which indicate the recommendation is no longer being presented to the user

name: getFlowAdvancingActions
description: Actions which should result in the flow advancing

name: isValidAction
description: Returns whether a given action is valid or not

name: src/model/collection-doc.js
CollectionDoc
description: A base model for any resources following our Collection Doc schema

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

name: _validate
description: Ensure that the given Collection Doc is valid

throws.description: if collection doc is invalid

name: collectionDoc
description: Exposed for legacy reasons. Prefer model accessor methods were possible.

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version of the Collection.Doc+JSON Hypermedia Type Specification being used by this document

properties.name: href
properties.description: A unique identifier of the resource representation in the form of a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI)

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: A set of metadata attributes that represent the "state" of the resource in the form of key-value pairs; may be an empty object

properties.name: items
properties.description: A list of items associated with this document; may be an empty array

properties.name: links
properties.description: A map of resources that expose controls and communicate relationships with other documents; the keys describe the relationship to the current document, while the values are arrays of links

properties.name: errors
properties.description: A list of errors encountered in the process of creating and/or retrieving this document, intended to facilitate reliable debugging of client/server interactions

properties.name: content-type
properties.description: The MIME-type of the resource

properties.name: href
properties.description: The URI that represents the resource

name: src/model/device-code.js
DeviceCode
description: A thin wrapper around the raw JSON returned from the authorization server to represent a device code/user code pair

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

name: validate
description: Ensure that the given device code model is valid

throws.description: if device code model is invalid

name: isExpired
description:
Returns whether or not this device code/user code pair has expired.
Note that due to network latency, etc., it's possible that the internally-stored expiry date could be about a
second or so behind, and so this function is not guaranteed to be perfectly accurate.

name: userCode
description: Returns the user code (8-character alphanumeric string)

name: verificationUri
description: Returns the verification URL (the place where the user should go on their mobile device or laptop to log in)

name: ttl
description:
Returns the TTL (in milliseconds) until this device code/user code pair expires. The SDK will automatically generate
a new key pair upon expiry, so consumers of the SDK will generally not have to use this value directly; however,
you may opt to display on the screen how much time the user has left to log in before a new code is generated.

name: interval
description:
Returns the interval (in milliseconds) at which the client (in this case the SDK) should poll the `POST /token`
endpoint (or the OAuth proxy that lies in between). Consumers of the SDK should generally not have to use this
value directly.

name: toString
description:
A convenience function to cast this object back to a string, generally only used by the {@link Logger} class.
In this case, we return the raw JSON string representing the entire object.

name: src/model/rating.js
Rating
description: Container class for all metadata pertaining to an action that a user has taken against a recommendation.

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

params.name: json.mediaId
params.description: The media id as given by the media object

params.name: json.origin
params.description: How the recommendation was generated

params.name: json.rating
params.description: String representing the rating (action)

params.name: json.elapsed
params.description: Number of seconds since the start of playback for this media item, as an integer

params.name: json.duration
params.description: Number of seconds this audio piece is expected to last

params.name: json.timestamp
params.description: ISO-8601 formatted date/time; typically replaced by the client with the actual rating time

params.name: json.channel
params.description: The channel this media item was pulled from

params.name: json.cohort
params.description: The primary cohort of the current logged-in user

params.name: json.affiliations
params.description: An array of IDs & other data about collections or podcasts the user has ratings for; produced by the server and should be sent back as received; used for tracking program and podcast suggestions

name: privateMemberReplacer
description: Only send the fields back that NPR has sent us

name: toString
description: A convenience function to cast this object back to a string, generally only used by the {@link Logger} class.

name: src/model/recommendation.js
Recommendation
description:
Container class for all metadata pertaining to a recommendation.

Provides metadata and the recordAction method, which sends feedback on user actions to NPR's APIs and advances the flow of audio recommendations to the user

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

name: attributes
description: The metadata used to describe this recommendation, such as type and title

name: ratings
description: An internal store of ratings collected for this application; should never be accessed directly by consumers

name: audio
description: The actual audio files associated with this recommendation; should never be empty

name: recommendations
description: A list of API calls the app can make to retrieve subsequent recommendations; should never be accessed directly by consumers

name: images
description: A list of images associated with this recommendation; could be empty

name: web
description: A list of links to other places where this story can be found on the web (for example, on NPR.org); could be empty

name: onramps
description: A list of links that are used as the canonical link(s) when sharing this story on social media

name: callsToAction
description: This is the `action` array from the API within `links`, and _NOT_ this SDK's notion of {@link Action}

name: impressions
description:
A list of API calls to make if this recommendation is of type `sponsorship` and the consuming client
has played the accompanying audio

name: relateds
description: A list of links to places where the app can take the user if they interact with this `sponsorship` item

name: relatedImpressions
description:
A list of API calls to make if this recommendation is of type `sponsorship` and the consuming client has
chosen to interact with the sponsorship item using the contents of {@link relateds}

name: _hasSentImpressions
description: Used to prevent impressions from being fired twice

name: _hydrate
description: Hydrate the internal member variables.

name: _validate
description: Determines whether the collection doc has the required fields for a valid recommendation

throws.description: if the collection doc is invalid

name: getImages
description: Returns a list of images associated with this recommendation

name: getAudio
description: Returns the actual audio files associated with this recommendation

name: getWeb
description: Returns a list of links to other places where this story can be found on the web (for example, on NPR.org)

name: getOnRamps
description: Returns a list of links that are used as the canonical link(s) when sharing this story on social media.

name: getImpressions
description:
Returns a list of API calls to make if this recommendation is of type `sponsorship` and the consuming client
has played the accompanying audio. Note that the SDK will take care of this automatically as long as the client
uses {@link recordAction} to send the rating.

name: getCallsToAction
getRelateds
description:
Returns a list of links to places where the app can take the user if they interact with this `sponsorship` item
(such as by clicking/tapping on the image or using a voice command to learn more)

name: getRelatedImpressions
description:
Returns a list of API calls to make if this recommendation is of type `sponsorship` and the consuming client
has chosen to interact with the sponsorship item using the contents returned by {@link getRelateds}. Note that
the SDK will take care of this automatically as long as the client uses {@link recordAction} to send the rating.

name: getRatings
description:
Returns an internal store of ratings collected for this application. This should never be accessed directly by
consumers; use {@link recordAction} to send ratings, and the SDK will figure out the appropriate time to make
the API call that submits them to the server.

name: getRecommendationUrl
description:
Returns the URL that should be used to obtain the next set of recommendations. This should typically not be used
by clients directly; use {@link recordAction} followed by {@link NprOneSDK#getRecommendation} instead.

name: getActionRecommendationUrl
description:
This method looks through the recommendation's action and related array to search for any URL starting with `'nprone://listen'`.
If found, everything from the query params is appended to the original recommendation URL.
This value is then used anytime a user indicates they want more similar stories by clicking or tapping on this recommendation.

For many recommendations, this will not exist and getRecommendationUrl is used instead.

name: isSponsorship
description: Returns whether this recommendation is of type `sponsorship`

name: isShareable
description: Returns whether this recommendation is shareable on social media

name: hasAction
description: Returns whether this recommendation has a given action

params.name: action
params.description: Which action to look up; should be one of the static string constants returned by {@link Action}

name: hasEndAction
description:
Returns whether this recommendation has received a rating indicating it is no longer
being presented to the user

name: recordAction
description: Record a user action taken and the time it was taken against this recommendation

params.name: action
params.description: Which action to record; should be one of the static string constants returned by {@link Action}

params.name: elapsedTimeInSeconds
params.description: The number of seconds this piece of audio has been playing for

name: setRatingReceivedCallback
description: A callback which provides for communication of a received rating

params.name: callback
params.description: A function to call whenever this recommendation has received a rating (action)

name: toString
description: A convenience function to cast this object back to a string, generally only used by the {@link Logger} class.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of recommendation, usually `audio`. Can also be `stationId`, `sponsorship`, etc.

properties.name: uid
properties.description: The universal identifier of the recommendation

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the recommendation

properties.name: skippable
properties.description: Whether or not the recommendation is skippable, usually true, but false for e.g. sponsorship

properties.name: slug
properties.description: A slug or category for the recommendation

properties.name: provider
properties.description: The provider of the story, usually `NPR`. Can also be a member station or third-party podcast provider.

properties.name: program
properties.description: The program as part of which this recommendation aired

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The duration of the audio according to the API; note that the actual duration can differ

properties.name: date
properties.description: ISO-8601 formatted date/time; the date at which the story was first published

properties.name: description
properties.description: A short description of the recommendation

properties.name: rationale
properties.description: The reason for recommending this piece to the listener

properties.name: button
properties.description: The text to display in a clickable button on a feature card

properties.name: form-factor
properties.description: The form-factor for the most appropriate display of or interaction with the resource, usually irrelevant unless there is more than one link of the same type

properties.name: rel
properties.description: The relation of the image to the content, which usually corresponds to the crop-type

properties.name: height
properties.description: The pixel height of the image

properties.name: width
properties.description: The pixel width of the image

name: src/model/station.js
Station
description: Container class for all metadata pertaining to an organization (member station) from the NPR One API

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

name: id
description:
Returns the unique ID that represents this station across NPR's various APIs. The ID is an integer between 1 and
9999, but it will always be returned in string format.

name: displayName
logo
description: Returns the logo for this station, if one can be found. If no logo can be found at all, this will return `null`.

name: tagline
description:
Returns the tagline for this station. This should be used as supplemental metadata for a station; it should never
be used as the sole identifying information. Note that while the majority of the stations in our system have
taglines, it is not guaranteed that each station has one.

name: callSignAndFrequency
description:
Returns the call sign, brand (AM or FM), and frequency together as one string, e.g. `'WAMU FM 88.5'` or
`'KCFR FM 90.1'` or `'KWSU AM 1250'`. Again, this should be treated as supplemental metadata for a station and
not the sole identifying information; where possible, stations prefer to be identified primarily by their
{@link displayName} and {@link logo}. However, some local stations are members of networks such as Colorado Public Radio
and therefore use the same display name and logo; in those cases, the call sign + band + frequency combination is
the main way to disambiguate between multiple stations in the same network. This value is guaranteed to be unique.

name: location
description:
Returns the location of the station, which always consists of a city and (abbreviated) state, e.g. `'Austin, TX'`
or `'Rochester, NY'`. Similarly to {@link callSignAndFrequency}, this is most useful for disambiguating between
multiple local stations in a bigger network such as Colorado Public Radio, which use the same {@link displayName}
and {@link logo}. Note that this value isn't guaranteed to be unique; some cities (e.g. Boston) have multiple
NPR stations.

name: homepageUrl
description: Returns the URL to the station's website, if available.

name: donationUrl
description: Returns the URL to the station's online donation page, if available.

name: isNprOneEligible
description: Returns whether or not the station is eligible for inclusion in NPR One applications.

name: attributes
description:
Returns the raw attributes that represent this station. Please use this with caution; the public accessor methods
in this class should be sufficient for most use cases, and consumers should rarely need to use this additional
metadata.

name: toString
description:
A convenience function to cast this object back to a string, generally only used by the {@link Logger} class.
In this case, we return the station's display name.

properties.name: orgId
properties.description: The system's unique ID for this station, used across NPR One Microservices and NPR's other APIs

properties.name: guid
properties.description: The system's internal unique identifier for a station, not typically used by other APIs or consumers

properties.name: brand
properties.description: An associative array of brand-related metadata for this station

properties.name: eligibility
properties.description: An associative array of eligibility-related metadata for this station

properties.name: newscast
properties.description: Metadata about the newscast for this station; newscasts are handled internally by other microservices such as the NPR One Listening Service, so this data should typically not be used by consumers

properties.name: Metadata
properties.description: about the network, if this station is part of a network

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name for the station. In most cases, this will be the same as call letters combined with band. When returning networks, it will return the network name (e.g. Minnesota Public Radio).

properties.name: call
properties.description: The three-to-four-letter identifying code for this station. Please use this with caution; most stations prefer to be identified by their name in client applications instead of call.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: Where on the radio dial the station can be heard. If the band is AM, the frequency will be between 540 and 1600. If the band is FM, the frequency will be between 87.8 and 108.0.

properties.name: band
properties.description: The subsection of the radio spectrum -- 'AM' or 'FM' -- where this station can be heard

properties.name: tagline
properties.description: A short text-logo for the station

properties.name: marketCity
properties.description: The city that the station is most closely associated with. This may or may not be the city the station is licensed in and it may or may not be the city that the station or the station's antenna is located in.

properties.name: marketState
properties.description: The state that the station is most closely associated with. This may or may not be the state the station is licensed in and it may or may not be the state that the station or the station's antenna is located in.

properties.name: nprOne
properties.description: Whether or not this organization is considered an NPR One station

properties.name: musicOnly
properties.description: Whether or not this station only plays music

properties.name: format
properties.description: The format of the programming on this station

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the station within NPR's system, not typically used by consumers

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the newscast that should be played for this station; this is handled internally by other microservices such as the NPR One Listening Service, so this field should typically not be used by consumers

properties.name: recency
properties.description: How often the newscast should be played, in minutes; a value of `null` implies no information is available, and sensible defaults should be used

properties.name: currentOrgId
properties.description: The current station being viewed. Client applications should generally ignore this field.

properties.name: usesInheritance
properties.description: Whether or not the current station inherits from a parent organization, also referred to as a network

properties.name: inheritingFrom
properties.description: The system' unique ID for the organization that the current station is inheriting from, if inheritance is on

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name for the current organization

properties.name: tier1
properties.description: The top-level organization, if this station is part of a network

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique identifier of the top-level organization in the network

properties.name: usesInheritance
properties.description: Whether or not this station inherits from a parent organization, also referred to as a network

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name for the top-level organization in the network

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the top-level organization within NPR's system, not typically used by consumers

properties.name: tier2
properties.description: One or more stations that are hierarchical children of this organization

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique identifier of a tier 2 organization in the network

properties.name: usesInheritance
properties.description: Whether or not this station inherits from a parent organization, also referred to as a network

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name for a tier 2 organization in the network

properties.name: tier3
properties.description: One or more stations that are hierarchical children of this organization

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique identifier of a tier 3 organization in the network

properties.name: usesInheritance
properties.description: Whether or not this station inherits from a parent organization, also referred to as a network

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name for a tier 3 organization in the network

name: src/model/user.js
User
description: Container class for all metadata pertaining to a user object from the NPR One API

params.name: json
params.description: The decoded JSON object that should be used as the basis for this model

name: _hydrate
description: Hydrate the internal member variables.

name: isTemporary
description: Whether this user is a temporary user or not

name: getCohort
description: Returns the user's cohort. In most cases, SDK consumers will never need to use this.

name: getOrganizations
description:
Returns the list of organizations this user is affiliated with. In most cases, you only want a single
organization, in which case {@link User#getPrimaryOrganization} should be used.

name: getPrimaryOrganization
description:
Returns the primary, non-NPR organization that this user is affiliated with, or null if no such organization
exists.

name: getAffiliations
description: Returns the programs, shows, and podcasts that this user has positively interacted with.

name: toString
description:
A convenience function to cast this object back to a string, generally only used by the {@link Logger} class.
In this case, we return the user's ID.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Some unique identifier for the user

properties.name: email
properties.description: The user's email address

properties.name: firstName
properties.description: The user's first name

properties.name: lastName
properties.description: The user's last name

properties.name: cohort
properties.description: The user's cohort (an experimental grouping for User Experience A/B Testing)

properties.name: organizations
properties.description: User's chosen NPR Member Station(s)

properties.name: affiliations
properties.description: Programs, shows, and podcasts that the user has positively interacted with

properties.name: id
properties.description: A short ID for this cohort

properties.name: name
properties.description: A text string identifying the cohort, useful for metrics

properties.name: directory
properties.description: For internal use only; represents the current configuration file being used by the Listening Service

properties.name: id
properties.description: Some unique identifier for the organization

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: A short displayable text field for the end user, strictly text

properties.name: call
properties.description: Station call letters

properties.name: city
properties.description: A short description of the station's main market city

properties.name: logo
properties.description: Station logo image URL

properties.name: donationUrl
properties.description: The URL to a website where users may make a donation to support the station

properties.name: id
properties.description: A unique identifier for the aggregation (program)

properties.name: title
properties.description: The display name of the aggregation (program)

properties.name: href
properties.description: A link that can be followed to get content from this aggregation (program)

properties.name: following
properties.description: Whether or not the user is following the aggregation. When changing affiliation status, the client is expected to toggle this value and then send the entire object back.

properties.name: rating
properties.description: The user's average rating for this affiliation on a scale of 0-1. Absent if user never listened to the aggregation.

properties.name: daysSinceLastListen
properties.description: The number of days since a user last listened to a story from this aggregation. Absent if user never listened to the aggregation.

name: src/util/fetch-util.js
delay
description: Simulates a delay by wrapping a Promise around JavaScript's native `setTimeout` function.

params.name: ms
params.description: The amount of time to delay for, in milliseconds

name: FetchUtil
description:
A thin wrapper around the Fetch API which provides functionality to automatically
request a new access token if an existing one has expired.

name: nprApiFetch
description: Primary workhorse for interacting with the NPR One APIs.

name: formatErrorResponse
description:
Wraps an error response from an API call in an {@link ApiError} object so that consuming code has more
flexibility to determine how to handle the error. To be clear: this function returns a Promise that **always**
rejects, but it may or may not have the deserialized JSON body based on whether `response.json()` succeeded or
failed (the latter is usually an indicator that the response had an empty body).

name: _attemptAccessTokenRefresh
description: The logic to attempt an access token refresh, broken out for easier readability.

name: _getHeaders
description: Ensures access token is defined and generates the required Headers object for fetch

name: _requestUrlIsAuthorizationCall
description: Tests whether or not the call to the given URL should be considered an authorization call.

src/util/recommendation-creator.js
createRecommendations

Creates recommendation objects from collection doc ensuring that necessary
